key_questions.users: Game Masters (GMs) running combat encounters with multiple minions in Foundry VTT
key_questions.goals: Streamline minion management during combat - control groups of minions (mobs) with a single interaction instead of clicking each individually
key_questions.first_action: Group existing minions into a mob so they can act together
key_questions.problems_to_eliminate: Tedious, repetitive clicking on every minion token to perform the same action across multiple minions
key_questions.value_drivers: Faster combat encounters, reduced GM cognitive load, automated tactical decisions via strategies
user_journey: 1. Create a mob - Define a new mob container
2. Add minions to the mob - Select and group minions into the mob
3. Determine strategy - Choose the appropriate targeting/action strategy
4. Action play - Execute coordinated mob actions during combat
key_questions.integrations: Foundry Virtual Tabletop (Foundry VTT) - this is a module/extension for their system
key_questions.game_system: Mutants & Masterminds 3rd Edition (M&M 3e) - Rules at Hero SRD, Foundry system on GitHub
key_questions.business_domain: Tactical combat automation for tabletop RPGs - specifically minion/mob management

core_concepts.mob: Collection of minions that act together as a unit
core_concepts.strategy: Targeting/action algorithm that determines mob behavior
core_concepts.mob_template: Reusable blueprint defining minion types, leader, and strategy - can spawn multiple mob instances
core_concepts.target: Selection mechanism for choosing who the mob attacks

evidence.integration_reference: Foundry VTT M&M 3e system on GitHub

key_questions.highest_risk_areas: Execute Mob Actions (Mob Combat Sequence) - system stories requiring Foundry VTT API integration, target selection algorithms, movement calculations, attack resolution. Secondary: Configure Strategy - strategy algorithms must implement M&M 3e combat rules correctly.
key_questions.highest_value_early: Manage Mobs > Create and Configure Mob - first user action in journey, addresses core problem of tedious clicking, enables all downstream functionality
key_questions.complexity_vs_value: Mob Templates is most complex relative to value (enhancement/convenience, not core). Execute Mob Actions is complex but high-value (core functionality).
key_questions.thin_slice_approach: End-to-end slices - each increment delivers working GM workflow (create mob -> assign strategy -> execute action), aligns with user journey approach
reusable_components: Mob - core concept used across all epics
Strategy - used by Configure Strategy and Execute Mob Actions
Target - shared between Strategy and Mob Combat Sequence
Foundry VTT integration layer - all features interact with Foundry API
key_questions.user_rollout_order: Single user type (GMs) - no multi-user rollout considerations

evidence.business_case: clarification.json - faster combat, reduced cognitive load
